courtauld.ac.uk/short-courses-2025/open-event/






Buy Tickets





020 3947 7650
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

The Courtauld Short Courses Free Open Event

New to art history? Unsure if The Courtauld is for you? Come and meet us over coffee, conversation and a range of short talks! We would like to invite anyone who wants to discover more about our programmes to a free morning of short engaging talks by a number of our lecturers. This will be a great opportunity to meet our team over coffee and cake on our Vernon Square campus, or online. Short Courses at The Courtauld are intended for everyone over the age of 18. Our courses are taught in several formats, on campus and online, and range from a termly two-hour Saturday Study Event, to courses over 3,4, or 5 days, or in the evenings over 5-10 weeks. All in-person, and some online courses, include visits to galleries and museums. Covering a global range of historical periods and art-historical themes, the Short Courses programme has much to offer to both novices and to participants with existing knowledge. The Open Event will take place on Saturday 25 January 2025, on campus at Vernon Square from 10:30 to 12:00 and online from 12:30 to 13:30. We look forward to meeting you – book your place now via our website below!

Sat 25 Jan 2025, 6:00PM - 7:00PM£25, £35, £45











Buy Tickets

About this Event

Vivaldi Four Seasons by Candlelight

The exceptional musicians of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta perform Vivaldi's master piece The Four Seasons and other outstanding works in the beautiful candlelit setting of St Mary Le Strand, London. A hugely appealing programme designed to help you celebrate the weekend in style! There are many restaurants and bars nearby to complete your evening. 'Stunning'  ClassicFM Note - there are two performances available: 6pm and 8pm FeaturingThe Piccadilly SinfoniettaViolin soloist to be announced soon ProgrammeMozart - Divertimento in Bb K137Vivaldi - The Four Seasons Since its formation in 2017, the Piccadilly Sinfonietta have become a regular feature on the UK concert scene, giving over 200 performances a year in some of the country’s most beautiful and prestigious venues. The ensemble comprises some of the most prodigious musical talent and performs exclusively with leading virtuoso soloists. The group performs under the artistic direction of its founder, concert pianist Warren Mailley-Smith and focuses on the virtuoso concerto repertoire of the baroque, classical and early romantic periods. Here's a short video of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta performingyoutu.be/gN157xwtsnM

About this Event

Red Handed: Will you Survive the night?

Channel your inner Squid Game contestant at Red Handed: Will You Survive the Night?—an exclusive black-tie immersive experience where strategy, deception, and high-stakes elimination will determine who survives. Are you ready to outsmart your opponents and make it through the night? ?What’s Included: ?Immersive Survival Game – A high-stakes elimination-style experience with real-time strategy and deception?20 Unique Roles – Each with special powers, objectives, and the possibility of changing teams?Exclusive Black-Tie Setting – Red carpet entrance, fine canapés, and a chocolate fountain?Food INCLUDED with ALL TICKETS?Limited to 150 Players – A one-night-only event, with limited spots available?Step into the ultimate test of strategy, deception, and survival at Red Handed: Will You Survive the Night? Inspired by the high-stakes intensity of Squid Game and the social manipulation of Mafia, this immersive black-tie social survival game challenges players to outwit, outlast, and outplay their opponents in a night of intense competition and elimination. ?Upon arrival, guests will receive a wax-sealed envelope containing their role card and a personalized letter explaining their role in the game. Some will be part of the Town Team, while others will join the Murderers Team. Each player will have a special power and secret objectives, adding layers of strategy and complexity. Players must “kill” (eliminate) their opponents through deception, alliances, and calculated moves—just like in Squid Game. ?As the game unfolds, allegiances will shift, and players may even change teams. Quirky roles like Oopsi Daisy, who accidentally eliminates others, will add to the chaos. Every player has a vital role to play in the pursuit of survival, and trust will be in short supply. ?Exclusive Sneak Preview: ?Ticket holders will gain exclusive access to a WhatsApp community where they’ll receive a sneak preview of their roles and get

description: Performer and drag icon Jonny Woo returns to Soho Theatre with a new personal cabaret Jonny Woo: Suburbia...

sections.text_content:

21 Dean Street, London W1D 3NE


view on map




Today

7 P.M.£14 - £25











Buy Tickets





020 7478 0100
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Jonny Woo: Suburbia

Performer and drag icon Jonny Woo returns to Soho Theatre with a new personal cabaret Jonny Woo: Suburbia.  Paying homage to his influential upbringing in the suburbs before his life in the big city lights and on stage, this theatre piece presents a poetic memoir charting his journey from a childhood in Medway, to the night clubs and sex dens of New York, to a queer community in London which he helped shape himself.  Featuring his signature 'alt-drag' and cabaret, spoken word, and storytelling, Jonny Woo: Suburbia presents Woo’s most honest piece to date, sharing the formative moments which influenced his career and life now.

event_title: Kensington Symphony Orchestra with top clarinetist Michael Collins
description: Kensington Symphony Orchestra joins forces with Michael Collins for Magnus Lindberg’s Clarinet Concerto (2001-02) at the Queen Elizabeth Hall on...
location: Quyeen Elizabeth Hall, Southbank Centre SE1 8XX

sections.text_content:
Kensington Symphony Orchestra with top clarinetist Michael Collins


Quyeen Elizabeth Hall, Southbank Centre, London SE1 8XX


view on map

020 3879 9555
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Kensington Symphony Orchestra with top clarinetist Michael Collins

Kensington Symphony Orchestra joins forces with Michael Collins for Magnus Lindberg’s Clarinet Concerto (2001-02) at the Queen Elizabeth Hall on Saturday 25 January – the renowned soloist’s first London performance of the work. One of the Finnish composer’s most frequently performed pieces, the concerto comprises a single movement divided into five sections. Restless but rhapsodic, its joyous evocation of nature has been described as “contemporary in language but sensuously easy on the ear”. Brimming with virtuosity, it is an ideal fit for Collins, acclaimed as “one of the best clarinettists walking the planet” by The Times. Music by Ravel book-ends the programme, which opens with Rapsodie espagnole (1907-08), one of the composer’s first major works for orchestra. Drawing on his Basque heritage, the colourful four-movement piece moves from the stillness of night to Spanish dances and a dazzling fiesta. Ravel described La valse (1919-20) – originally conceived as a ballet – as a depiction of waltzing couples in an imperial court, initially seen through whirling clouds. Beginning with kaleidoscopic fragments of melodies, this popular work builds inexorably to a tumultuous, thrilling finale. Music director Russell Keable also leads the orchestra in a performance of Prokofiev’s Lieutenant Kijé (1933-34). The composer viewed his first film score – accompanying a satire on Russian royalty – as an opportunity to adopt a more accessible style, and the resulting five-movement suite is oneof his most popular works. Described as “one of the very best amateur groups in the country” by Classical Music magazine, KSO has been hailed by Classical Source for “putting on bold, adventurous programmes that few of the ‘big five’ in London would either think of or get away with”.

location: Leicester Square Theatre, 6 Leicester Pl, London WC2H 7BX

sections.text_content:

Leicester Square Theatre, 6 Leicester Pl, London WC2H 7BX


view on map




Monday 27 January

7.30pm £20











Buy Tickets





07710469141
for latest times or cancellations.
Spread the word

About this Event

Showstopper! The Improvised Musical

The incredible ‘Showstopper! The Improvised Musical’ has extended their residency in the West End at the Cambridge Theatre for the third year with new dates added throughout 2025!  Spontaneous musical comedy at its finest, this is the first ever long-form improv show to have a full West End run and to be nominated and win an Olivier Award! Completely improvised and genuinely entirely different every night, this is a must-see show!  For those who haven’t yet experienced the live phenomenon that is ‘Showstopper! The Improvised Musical’, the show is a fully realised musical created on the spot from audience suggestions. The cast transform suggestions for settings, genres, musical styles and even the name of the show into ingenious storylines with hilarious characters. From Lin Manuel Miranda to Stephen Sondheim, via a primary school, Ancient Egypt, or a mattress shop – if the audience can suggest it, The Showstoppers will perform it. It’s hugely funny to watch.

About this Event

Thursday Night Live

Every Thursday night, live music, food and drink at Sarastro. Hosted by Colin Roy who began a successful career in London’s West End theatre scene starring in many renowned shows including Five Guy’s Named Moe, Sweet Charity, Smokey Joe’s Cafe, Hair and Soul Train. Colin Roy first spotted by the casting director for the Lion King sings the best in Motown, Jazz, Pop, 70s & 80s and encourages guests to dance the night away. Accompanied by his own DJ this unmissable evening is one of the most best kept secrets in London.

description: Enjoy an exceptional classical harp recital in the beautiful candlelit setting of St Mary Le Strand. A hugely appealing programme by leading harpist.....
location: St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES

sections.text_content:
Classical Harp by Candlelight


St Mary Le Strand Church, London WC2R 1ES


view on map




Thursday 30 January

Thu 30 Jan 2025, 8:00PM - 9:00PM£20, £30,











Buy Tickets
Spread the word

About this Event

Classical Harp by Candlelight

Enjoy an exceptional classical harp recital in the beautiful candlelit setting of St Mary Le Strand. A hugely appealing programme by leading harpist Esther Beyer to start your weekend in style! There are also a good choice of restaurants and bars nearby to complete your evening FeaturingEsther Beyer (harp) ProgrammeC.P.E Bach - Sonata for Harp in G majorClaude Debussy - Premiere ArabesqueCaroline Lizotte - Suite GalactiqueGabriel Fauré - Impromptu for HarpMarcel Grandjany - Rhapsodie About Esther Beyer Described as “a sparkling presence” by Seen and Heard International (2022), Esther Beyer is an award-winning harpist and educator based in London. Competition successes include first place in the inaugural Royal Academy of Music Bicentenary Prize (held at Wigmore Hall, 2020) and reaching the final of the 2020 Sir Karl Jenkins Music Award (in association with Classic FM). Esther is also a yeoman of The Musician’s Company. Notable solo highlights include performing for HRH Duchess of Cornwall on the Royal Harp at Clarence House. A passionate orchestral musician, Esther has worked with orchestras including the London Philharmonic Orchestra, Royal Liverpool Philharmonic Orchestra, English National Ballet and Northern Ballet, for conductors such as Sir Mark Elder, Edward Gardner and Vasily Petrenko.

About this Event

Mozart Piano Concertos by Candlelight

Enjoy an outstanding musical evening with an exceptional selection from Mozart's much-loved Piano Concertos.  Set in the spectacular candlelit venue of St Mary Le Strand Church and featuring a renowned concert pianist Christina Lawrie along with the exceptional  musicians of the The Piccadilly Sinfonietta, this will be a concert to remember! There are also plenty of restaurants and bars nearby to complete your night. 'Stunning' - Classic FM FeaturingThe Piccadilly SinfoniettaChristina Lawrie (piano) ProgrammeMozart - Marriage of FigaroMozart - Eine Kleine NachtmusikMozart - Piano Concerto K466 in D minor Since its formation in 2017, the Piccadilly Sinfonietta has become a regular feature on the UK concert scene, giving over 200 100 performances a year in some of the country’s most beautiful and prestigious venues. The ensemble comprises some of the most prodigious musical talent and performs exclusively with leading virtuoso soloists. The group performs under the artistic direction of its founder, concert pianist Warren Mailley-Smith and focuses on the virtuoso concerto repertoire of the baroque, classical and early romantic periods.

view on map




Friday 31 January

Fri 31 Jan 2025, 8:00PM - 9:00PM£20, £30, £40











Buy Tickets
Spread the word

About this Event

Bach Cello Suites by Candlelight

Enjoy an exceptional performance of a selection of J.S. Bach's Solo Cello Suites by renowned cellist, Kirsten Jenson. Set in the beautiful candlelit location of St Mary Le Strand, London, it's a hugely appealing programme that will start your weekend in style! There's a good choice of bars and restaurants nearby to complete your night. FeaturingKirsten Jenson (cello) ProgrammeJ.S. Bach - Suite no 1 in G major for solo celloJ.S. Bach - Suite no 2 in D minor for solo celloJ.S. Bach - Suite no 3 in C major for solo cello About Kirsten Jenson A recipient of numerous prizes and awards, Kirsten made her solo debut playing the Schumann Cello Concerto with the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra while studying with renowned soloist and pedagogue Johannes Goritzki. Since then, Kirsten has developed a busy freelance career focussed predominantly on her love of chamber music. After finishing her studies in Switzerland, Kirsten joined the Ragazze Quartet in Holland, with whom she released albums under the label Channel Classics and performed regularly on live TV, radio, and at major venues including the Royal Concertgebouw. Since returning to the UK, Kirsten was awarded Best British Cellist at the 2016 International Music Competition Grand Prize Virtuoso and has guested with numerous ensembles including the historic Allegri Quartet and the Primrose Piano Quartet, and regularly performs as a duo with celebrated pianist John Thwaites.

About this Event

Bach and Vivaldi Violin Concertos by Candlelight

The exceptional musicians of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta perform a selection of Bach's magnificent Violin concertos by candlelight in the beautiful setting of St Mary Le Strand, London.  A hugely appealing evening designed to help you celebrate the weekend in style! There are also plenty of bars and restaurants nearby to complete your night. 'Stunning' - Classic FM Note - there are two performances available: 6pm and 8pm FeaturingThe Piccadilly SinfoniettaVictoria Lyon (violin) Programme Bach - Violin Concerto in E Major, BWV 1042 Bach - Air on a G String (from Orchestral Suite No. 3 in D Major, BWV 1068) Vivaldi - Double Violin Concerto in A Minor, RV 522 Bach - Concerto for Two Violins in D Minor, BWV 1043 Since its formation in 2017, the Piccadilly Sinfonietta have become a regular feature on the UK concert scene, giving over 200 performances a year in some of the country’s most beautiful and prestigious venues. The ensemble comprises some of the most prodigious musical talent and performs exclusively with leading virtuoso soloists. The group performs under the artistic direction of its founder, concert pianist Warren Mailley-Smith and focuses on the virtuoso concerto repertoire of the baroque, classical and early romantic periods. Here's a short video of the Piccadilly Sinfonietta performing: youtu.be/gN157xwtsnM
